items.content:
To be able to read, listen, speak and write better, you will need to know your grammar! In this theme you are going to repeat or learn more about:

  • present simple and past simple
  • present simple and present continuous
  • past simple and present perfect
  • passive sentences
  • conditionals

For each grammar item, there is an explanation and there are exercises.
Try to do as many exercises as possible!

Good luck!

Have a look at the following:

KB: Grammar: Present simple
KB: Grammar: Past simple (regular verbs)
KB: Grammar: Past simple (irregular verbs)

Now you are ready to do the following exercises (again).

content.body:
Vul de juiste vorm van het werkwoord in.

It every day in the Netherlands. (to rain).
We games every afternoon. (to play).
I in my sleep. (to talk).
He home after soccer practice. (to walk).
Derek many cartoon characters. (to draw).
After running they always a lot of water. (to drink)
We never any snacks after eight o'clock. (to eat)
You Idols every Saturday. (to watch)

Vul de juiste vorm van het werkwoord in.

Tim many cartoon characters. (to draw).
He at six o'clock each workday. (to get up)
He to work and begins his job at eight o'clock. (to drive)
He to people on the telephone to help them. (to speak)
He doesn't give information until they a few questions. (to answer).
Tim callers their birth date. (to ask)
Sometimes a person incorrect information. (to give)
Tim watching TV after dinner. (to like)

prompt.body:
Is in de volgende zinnen de past simple goed gebruikt?
Kies het juiste antwoord.

We cycled to France last year.

Is in de volgende zinnen de past simple goed gebruikt?
Kies het juiste antwoord.

Did they played a game?

Is in de volgende zinnen de past simple goed gebruikt?
Kies het juiste antwoord.

Washed my father his car last Sunday?

Is in de volgende zinnen de past simple goed gebruikt?
Kies het juiste antwoord.

He banged his had.

Is in de volgende zinnen de past simple goed gebruikt?
Kies het juiste antwoord.

They didn't arrive on time.

Is in de volgende zinnen de past simple goed gebruikt?
Kies het juiste antwoord.

She didn´t brushed her teeth this morning.

Is in de volgende zinnen de past simple goed gebruikt?
Kies het juiste antwoord.

He cheated on his test.

Is in de volgende zinnen de past simple goed gebruikt?
Kies het juiste antwoord.

My father didn´t accept the gift.

Is in de volgende zinnen de past simple goed gebruikt?
Kies het juiste antwoord.

Did they apologised after the fight?

Is in de volgende zinnen de past simple goed gebruikt?
Kies het juiste antwoord.

He lived in New York in 2009.

Is in de volgende zinnen de past simple goed gebruikt?
Kies het juiste antwoord.

Seamus dropped his keys.

Is in de volgende zinnen de past simple goed gebruikt?
Kies het juiste antwoord.

Did she worked hard?

Is in de volgende zinnen de past simple goed gebruikt?
Kies het juiste antwoord.

He didn't walk to school yesterday?

Is in de volgende zinnen de past simple goed gebruikt?
Kies het juiste antwoord.

Arrived they on time yesterday?

content.body:
Vul de juiste vorm van het werkwoord in.
Gebruik de past simple.

He (walk) to school yesterday.
she (work) hard?
My mother (worry) when Peter didn't come home last night.
Seamus (not drop) his keys.

Vul de juiste vorm van het werkwoord in.
Gebruik de past simple.

This morning we (talk) about it.
He (live) in New York in 2009.
they (apologise) after their fight?
My father (not accept) the gift.

Vul de juiste vorm van het werkwoord in.
Gebruik de past simple.

Our teacher (talk) about Robin Hood last week.
Robin Hood (live) in Sherwood Forrest long ago.
He (not like) King John, who was a bad king.
he (marry) Lady Marianne in the end?

Vul de juiste vorm van het werkwoord in. Gebruik de past simple.

I (receive) a letter last week.
My brother (wash) his car last month.
Debby (not play) here yesterday.
We (dance) until 4 in the morning.

Vul de verleden tijd van het werkwoord in.

to buy -
to do -

to leave -

Vul de verleden tijd van het werkwoord in.

to tell -
to think -

to wear -

items.content:
Have a look at Kennisbank Present continuous.

KB: Present continuous


Now you are ready to do the following exercises.

If you like to practice extra:

  • Present continuous

prompt.body: In welke zin is de present continuous gebruikt?
In welke zin is de present continuous gebruikt?

content.body: He likes standing on his head.
He is standing on his head.

prompt.body: In welke zin is de present continuous gebruikt?

content.body: The weather has been getting better.

prompt.body: In welke zin is de present continuous gebruikt?

content.body: What are you doing this evening?
What will you be doing this evening?

prompt.body: In welke zin is de present continuous gebruikt?

content.body: The number of accidents is falling rapidly.
The number of accidents falls every year.

prompt.body: In welke zin is de present continuous gebruikt?
In welke zin is de present continuous gebruikt?

content.body: Is he watching an interesting movie?
Has he been watching an interesting movie?

prompt.body: In welke zin is de present continuous gebruikt?

content.body: I have been repairing my bike.

prompt.body: In welke zin is de present continuous gebruikt?

content.body: Come on, we're waiting for you.
Come on, we have been waiting for you.

prompt.body: In welke zin is de present continuous gebruikt?

content.body: We're going to my sister's tomorrow.
We go to my sister's tomorrow.

Deze oefening gaat over de present continuous.
Je krijgt een aantal zinnen met gaten te zien.

Welke woorden moeten ingevuld worden?
Vul steeds de juiste vorm van het werkwoord in.

I (watch) an interesting movie.
Sue (read) a book.
We (play) football.
They (work) at the moment.

Deze oefening gaat over de present continuous.
Je krijgt een aantal zinnen met gaten te zien.

Welke woorden moeten ingevuld worden?
Vul steeds de juiste vorm van het werkwoord in.

He (stand) on his head.
I (cycling) to school.
The weather (get) better.
Look! Sam and Tom (play) football.

Deze oefening gaat over de present continuous.
Je krijgt een aantal zinnen met gaten te zien.

Welke woorden moeten ingevuld worden?
Vul steeds de juiste vorm van het werkwoord in.

The teacher (explain) the lesson.
Listen! Susan (play) the guitar.
We (go) to my sister's tomorrow.
You (swim) with our clothes on.

prompt.body:
Zet de werkwoorden tussen haakjes in de juiste tijd.

I ... (work) in an office from 9 to 5, but at the moment I ... (work not).

Zet de werkwoorden tussen haakjes in de juiste tijd.

Every day Sarah ... (go) to school by bus but now she ... (cycle) to school.

Zet de werkwoorden tussen haakjes in de juiste tijd.

Sam, what ... you ... (do)? I ... (swim) with my clothes on.

Zet de werkwoorden tussen haakjes in de juiste tijd.

James normally ... (work) as a butler but now he ... (play) football.

Zet de werkwoorden tussen haakjes in de juiste tijd.

Listen! Susan ... (play) the guitar. She always ... (practise) on Sundays.

Zet de werkwoorden tussen haakjes in de juiste tijd.

I ... (drink) a lot of cola, but now I ... (drink) a pint of beer.

Zet de werkwoorden tussen haakjes in de juiste tijd.

Compaq ... (make) computers and Philips also ... (make) computers.

Zet de werkwoorden tussen haakjes in de juiste tijd.

Look! Sam ... (play) football. He never ... (play) football.

Zet de werkwoorden tussen haakjes in de juiste tijd.

Sshht, I ... (watch) TV. You know that I always ... (watch) TV on Saturdays.

Zet de werkwoorden tussen haakjes in de juiste tijd.

Usually he ... (watch) a video at home but now he ... (watch) a film in the cinema.

Kies steeds het juiste antwoord.

Is Brian reading a book?

Kies steeds het juiste antwoord.

What is Brian reading?

Kies steeds het juiste antwoord.

Is Susan writing a poem?

Kies steeds het juiste antwoord.

Is this your book?

Kies steeds het juiste antwoord.

Is your brother playing hockey?

Kies steeds het juiste antwoord.

Does your nephew go to school?

Kies steeds het juiste antwoord.

What is your father doing?

Kies steeds het juiste antwoord.

Is your aunt studying English?

Kies steeds het juiste antwoord.

What are you doing?

Kies steeds het juiste antwoord.

Is your sister using your computer?

content.body:
Vul de juiste vorm van het werkwoord in. Gebruik de past continuous.

I (watch) a film.
We (enjoy) the countryside when we spotted something was wrong.
John (work) for this firm in the 1970s.
Jack (do) his homework when Susie rang and asked him out.

Vul de juiste vorm van het werkwoord in. Gebruik de past continuous.

She (have) a bath when the telephone rang.
We saw a lot of rubbish when we (walk) through the park.
My friend (paint) the door when someone came in.
He (play) tennis from 3 till 4 yesterday afternoon.

Vul de juiste vorm van het werkwoord in. Gebruik de past continuous.

What you (do) last night at seven?
They (do) exercises all morning.
Pamela (read) a book when her mother arrived.
Jack (smoke) a cigarette when the headmaster saw him.

Vul de juiste vorm van het werkwoord in. Gebruik de past continuous.

Brendon (repair) his motorbike when his mother called for dinner.
When my mother opened the door, my friend and I (kiss) in the hall.
When her dad came in, Jaimy (eat) crisps.
I (have) a shower when the telephone rang.

prompt.body:
Gebruik de past continuous.

Sarah and John ..... for this firm in the 1970s.

Gebruik de past continuous.

Gebruik de past continuous.

Gebruik de past continuous.

Gebruik de past continuous.

My friend ........... the door when someone came in.

Gebruik de past continuous.

I ............ a film.

Gebruik de past continuous.

They ..... not ..... teacher.

Gebruik de past continuous.

They ....... exercises all morning.

Gebruik de past continuous.

When my mother ..... the door, my friend and I ..... in the hall.

Gebruik de past continuous.

When her dad ....... in, Jaimy ........ crisps.

Gebruik de past continuous.

We ...... to Glasgow when we ....... out of petrol.

Gebruik de past continuous.

I ........ a shower when the telephone ....... .

Gebruik de past continuous.

Brendon ........ his motorbike when his mother ..... for dinner.

Gebruik de past continuous.

Jack ......... a cigarette when the headmaster ......... him.

Gebruik de past continuous.

Pamela ........ a book when her mother .......... .

items.content:
Past simple en present perfect
Do you remember them? The past simple and present perfect?
Have a look at the Kennisbank past simple and 'kennisbank present perfect' to revise them.

KB: Present perfect

KB: Simple past

Now try the following exercises.


If you like to practise extra:

  • Multiple-choice exercise

prompt.body:
Is in de volgende zinnen de past simple goed gebruikt?
Kies het goede antwoord.

Kies de beste vorm van het werkwoord in de volgende zinnen.

Kies de beste vorm van het werkwoord in de volgende zinnen.

Kies de beste vorm van het werkwoord in de volgende zinnen.

I ..... my binder yesterday, but my brother found it this morning.

Kies de beste vorm van het werkwoord in de volgende zinnen.

The children ..... all the orange juice! We'll need to get some more.

Kies de beste vorm van het werkwoord in de volgende zinnen.

We ..... this TV set since 1988, and it still works.

Kies de beste vorm van het werkwoord in de volgende zinnen.

This wine ..... in the cellar for 15 years. When we take it out and open it, it will taste beautiful.

Kies de beste vorm van het werkwoord in de volgende zinnen.

I ..... some new shorts, but I don't think I like them. Maybe I'll take them back to the store.

Kies de beste vorm van het werkwoord in de volgende zinnen.

Somebody ..... my bicycle! Now I'll have to walk home.

Kies de beste vorm van het werkwoord in de volgende zinnen.

I ..... Michael for 3 days.

Kies de beste vorm van het werkwoord in de volgende zinnen.

Gerry ..... off his bike three times this month.

Kies de beste vorm van het werkwoord in de volgende zinnen.

Ouch! I ..... my finger!

items.content:
Simple Past, Present Perfect and Past Perfect
When talking about verb tenses, it is important to keep apart Form and Use.
The use of the verb tenses sometimes diverges from Dutch.

In this section, three verb tenses are treated:

KB: Simple past

KB: Past perfect

KB: Present perfect

For those who want to know more, you can follow the link to the Kennisbank Present Perfect Extra.
It is pretty advanced stuff. On the other hand, it is English, isn't it?
When in doubt, consult your teacher.

KB: Present perfect - extra

Study the words of the Irregular Verb list.

Grammar exercises
You will now do some exercises.

Select the correct form. Simple Past or Past Perfect?

  1. After Fred [spent/had spent] his holiday in Italy he [wanted/had wanted] to learn Italian.
  2. Jill [phoned/had phoned] Dad at work before she [left/had left] for her trip.
  3. Susan [turned/had turned] on the radio after she [washed/had washed] the dishes.
  4. When she [arrived/had arrived] the match [started already/had already started].
  5. After the man [came/had come] home he fed the cat.
  6. Before he [sang/had sung] a song he [played/had played] the guitar.
  7. She [watched/had watched] a video after the children [went/had gone] to bed.
  8. After Eric [made/had made] breakfast he [phoned/had phoned] his friend.
  9. I [was/had been] very tired because I [studied/had studied] too much.
  10. They [rode/had ridden] their bikes before they [met/had met] their friends.


Select the correct form. Simple Past or Present Perfect?

  1. Mother: I want to prepare dinner. [Did you wash/Have you washed] the dishes yet?
  2. Daughter: [I washed/I have washed] the dishes yesterday, but I [had not/have not had] the time yet to do it today.
  3. Mother: [Did you already do/Have you already done] your homework?
  4. Daughter: No, [I just came/I have just come] home from school.
  5. Mother: [You came/You have come] home from school two hours ago!
  6. Daughter: Well, but my friend Lucy [called/has called] when I [arrived/have arrived] and I [just finished/have just finished] the phone call.
  7. Mother: [Didn't you see/Haven't you seen] Lucy at school in the morning?
  8. Daughter: Yes, but we [had not/did not have] time to talk then.


Select the form. Simple Past or Past Perfect?

  1. I can't believe I (get) [had got/got] that apartment.
  2. I (submit) [had submitted/submitted] my application last week, but I didn't think I had a chance of actually getting it.
  3. When I (show) [had showed/ showed] up to take a look around, there were at least twenty other people who (arrive) [had arrived/arrived] before me.
  4. Most of them (fill, already) [had already filled/already filled] out their applications and were already leaving.
  5. The landlord said I could still apply, so I did.
  6. I (try) [had tried/tried] to fill out the form, but I couldn't answer half of the questions.
  7. They (want) [had wanted/wanted] me to include references, but I didn't want to list my previous landlord because I (have) [had had/had] some problems with him in the past and I knew he wouldn't recommend me.
  8. I (end) [had ended/ended] up listing my father as a reference.
  9. It was total luck that he (decide) [had decided/decided] to give me the apartment.
  10. It turns out that the landlord and my father (go) [had gone/went] to high school together.
  11. He decided that I could have the apartment before he (look) [had looked/looked] at my credit report.
    I really lucked out!

content.body:
Fill in the Simple Past Tense of the verb in parentheses.

  • Yesterday I (to have) a really bad day.

Fill in the Simple Past Tense of the verb in parentheses.

  • I (to wake) up at 9 o'clock because I (to forget) to set my alarm clock the night before.

Fill in the Simple Past Tense of the verb in parentheses.

  • I (get) up as fast as I (can) and I (to put) on some clothes.

Fill in the Simple Past Tense of the verb in parentheses.

  • I ran into the kitchen and (to make) myself a cup of coffee.

Fill in the Simple Past Tense of the verb in parentheses.

  • Then I (to drink) the coffee very fast and I (to run) to my car.

Fill in the Simple Past Tense of the verb in parentheses.

  • It (to be) a terrible morning!

prompt.body:
Select the correct form of Simple Past or Present Perfect.

I ..................... volleyball in several months.

header.title: Simple Past, Present Perfect or Past Perfect

content.body:
Fill in the right form. Simple Past, Present Perfect or Past Perfect?

  • When I [arrived/have arrived/had arrived] home last night, I discovered that Jane [prepared/has prepared/had prepared] a beautiful candlelight dinner.

Fill in the right form. Simple Past, Present Perfect or Past Perfect?

  • Since I began acting, I [performed/have performed/had performed] in two plays, a television commercial and a TV drama. However, I [never even spoke/have never even spoken/had never even spoken] publicly before I came to Hollywood in 1985.

Fill in the right form. Simple Past, Present Perfect or Past Perfect?

  • By the time I got to the office, the meeting [already began/has already begun/ had already begun] without me.
  • My boss [was/has been/had been] furious with me and I [was/have been/had been] fired.

Fill in the right form. Simple Past, Present Perfect or Past Perfect?

  • When I [turned/have turned/had turned] the radio on yesterday, I [heard/have heard/had heard] a song that was popular when I was in high school.
  • I [heard/have not heard/had not heard] the song in years, and it [brought/has brought/had brought] back some great memories.

Fill in the right form. Simple Past, Present Perfect or Past Perfect?

  • Last week, I [ran/have run/had run] into an ex-girlfriend of mine. We [did not see/have not seen/ had not seen] each other in years, and both of us [ changed/have changed/had changed] a great deal. I [enjoyed/have enjoyed/had enjoyed] talking to her so much that I [asked/have asked/had asked] her out on a date. We are getting together tonight for dinner.

Fill in the right form. Simple Past, Present Perfect or Past Perfect?

  • When Jack [entered/have entered/had entered] the room, I [did not recognize/have not recognized/had not recognized] him because he [lost/has lost/had lost] so much weight and [grew/has grown/had grown] a beard. He looked totally different!

Fill in the right form. Simple Past, Present Perfect or Past Perfect?

  • The Maya established a very advanced civilization in the jungles of the Yucatan; however, their culture [virtually disappeared/has virtually disappeared/had virtually disappeared] by the time Europeans first [arrived/have arrived/had arrived] in the New World.

Fill in the right form. Simple Past, Present Perfect or Past Perfect?

  • I [visited/have visited/had visited] so many beautiful places since I [came/have come/had come] to Utah. Before moving here, I [did never hear/have never heard/had never heard] of Bryce Canyon, Zion, Arches, or Canyonlands.

content.body:
Supply the correct verb form to complete the sentences. Simple Past or Present Perfect?

  • He there when he was a child. (to live)

Supply the correct verb form to complete the sentences. Simple Past or Present Perfect?

  • I not her since last year. (to see)

Supply the correct verb form to complete the sentences. Simple Past or Present Perfect?

Supply the correct verb form to complete the sentences. Simple Past or Present Perfect?

  • She not unemployed since she left school. (to be)

Supply the correct verb form to complete the sentences. Simple Past or Present Perfect?

  • The film yet. (not / to start)

Supply the correct verb form to complete the sentences. Simple Past or Present Perfect?

  • She ill since Thursday. (to be)

Supply the correct verb form to complete the sentences. Simple Past or Present Perfect?

  • you ever to Rome? (ever / to be)

Supply the correct verb form to complete the sentences. Simple Past or Present Perfect?

  • Nobody the phone when it rang. (to answer)

Supply the correct verb form to complete the sentences. Simple Past or Present Perfect?

  • You can't see her because she home. (to go)

Supply the correct verb form to complete the sentences. Simple Past or Present Perfect?

  • you to the United States? (ever / to be)

Make the positive Past Perfect.

  • When I arrived at the cinema, the film (start) .

Make the positive Past Perfect.

  • She (live) in China before she went to Thailand.

Make the positive Past Perfect.

  • After they (eat) the shellfish, they began to feel sick.

Make the positive Past Perfect.

  • If you (listen) to me, you would have got the job.

Make the positive Past Perfect.

  • Julie didn't arrive until after I (leave) .

Make the positive Past Perfect.

  • When we (finish) dinner, we went out.

Make the positive Past Perfect.

  • The garden was dead because it (be) dry all summer.

Make the positive Past Perfect.

  • He (meet) her somewhere before.

Make the positive Past Perfect.

  • We were late for the plane because we (forget) our passports.

Make the positive Past Perfect.

  • She told me she (study) a lot before the exam.

Make the negative Past Perfect.

  • The grass was yellow because it (not /to rain) all summer.

Make the negative Past Perfect.

  • The lights went off because we (not / to pay) the electricity bill.

Make the negative Past Perfect.

  • The children (not /to do) their homework, so they were in trouble.

Make the negative Past Perfect.

  • They (not /to eat) so we went to a restaurant.

Make the negative Past Perfect.

  • We couldn't go into the concert because we (not /to bring) our tickets.

Make the negative Past Perfect.

  • She said that she (not /to visit) the UK before.

Make the negative Past Perfect.

  • Julie and Anne (not /not meet) before the party.

Make the negative Past Perfect.

  • I (not /to have) breakfast when he arrived.

Make the negative Past Perfect.

  • He (not /to use) email before, so I showed him how to use it.

Make the negative Past Perfect.

  • You (not / study) for the test, so you were very nervous.

Vul de juiste vorm van het werkwoord in.

It every day in the Netherlands. (to rain).
We games every afternoon. (to play).
I in my sleep. (to talk).
He home after soccer practice. (to walk).
Derek many cartoon characters. (to draw).
After running they always a lot of water. (to drink)
We never any snacks after eight o'clock. (to eat)
You Idols every Saturday. (to watch)

Vul de juiste vorm van het werkwoord in.

Tim many cartoon characters. (to draw).
He at six o'clock each workday. (to get up)
He to work and begins his job at eight o'clock. (to drive)
He to people on the telephone to help them. (to speak)
He doesn't give information until they a few questions. (to answer).
Tim callers their birth date. (to ask)
Sometimes a person incorrect information. (to give)
Tim watching TV after dinner. (to like)

items.content:
Passive voice is used when the focus is on the action. It is not important or not known, however, who or what is performing the action.

Example: My bike was stolen.

In the example above, the focus is on the fact that my bike was stolen. I do not know, however, who did it.

Sometimes a statement in passive is more polite than active voice, as the following example shows:

Example: A mistake was made.

In this case, I focus on the fact that a mistake was made, but I do not blame anyone (e.g. You have made a mistake.).

Form of Passive

Subject + finite form of to be + Past Participle (3rd column of irregular verbs)

Example: A letter was written.

When rewriting active sentences in passive voice, note the following:

  • the object of the active sentence becomes the subject of the passive sentence
  • the finite form of the verb is changed (to be + past participle)
  • the subject of the active sentence becomes the object of the passive sentence (or is dropped)

Conditional Sentences are also known as Conditional Clauses or If Clauses. They are used to express that the action in the main clause (without if) can only take place if a certain condition (in the clause with if) is fulfilled. There are three types of Conditional Sentences.

Conditional Sentence Type 1

→ It is possible and also very likely that the condition will be fulfilled.

Form: if + Simple Present, will-Future

Example: If I find her address, I'll send her an invitation.

Conditional Sentence Type 2

→ It is possible but very unlikely, that the condition will be fulfilled.

Form: if + Simple Past, Conditional I (= would + Infinitive)

Example: If I found her address, I would send her an invitation.

Conditional Sentence Type 3

→ It is impossible that the condition will be fulfilled because it refers to the past.

Form: if + Past Perfect, Conditional II (= would + have + Past Participle)

Example: If I had found her address, I would have sent her an invitation.
